vega.Account.description: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party

balance.description: Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places and importantly balances cannot be negative

id.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

market_id.description: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

owner.description: The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

type.description: The account type related to this account

vega.AccountType.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

vega.AddValidator.description: A message to notify when a new validator is being added to the Vega network

id.description: The identifier of the validator

vega.Asset.description: The Vega representation of an external asset

details.description: The definition of the external source for this asset

decimals.description: Number of decimal / precision handled by this asset

name.description: Name of the asset (e.g: Great British Pound)

quantum.description: The minimum economically meaningful amount in the asset

max_faucet_amount_mint.description: Maximum amount that can be requested by a party through the built-in asset faucet at a time

contract_address.description: The address of the contract for the token, on the ethereum network

total_supply.description: Total circulating supply for the asset

id.description: Internal identifier of the asset

vega.AuctionDuration.description: An auction duration is used to configure 3 auction periods: 1. `duration > 0`, `volume == 0`: The auction will last for at least N seconds 2. `duration == 0`, `volume > 0`: The auction will end once we can close with given traded volume 3. `duration > 0`, `volume > 0`: The auction will take at least N seconds, but can end sooner if we can trade a certain volume

duration.description: Duration of the auction in seconds

vega.AuctionIndicativeState.description: AuctionIndicativeState is used to emit an event with the indicative price/volume per market during an auction

auction_end.description: The timestamp at which the auction is meant to stop

auction_start.description: The timestamp at which the auction started

indicative_price.description: The Indicative Uncrossing Price is the price at which all trades would occur if we uncrossed the auction now

indicative_volume.description: The Indicative Uncrossing Volume is the volume available at the Indicative crossing price if we uncrossed the auction now

market_id.description: The market identifier for which this state relates to

vega.AuctionTrigger.description: Auction triggers indicate what condition triggered an auction (if market is in auction mode)

address.description: Address of the contract for this Ethereum network. The address should start with "0x".

deployment_block_height.description: Block height at which the stacking contract has been deployed for this Ethereum network.

confirmations.description: Number of block confirmations to wait to consider an Ethereum transaction trusted. An Ethereum block is trusted when there are at least "n" blocks confirmed by the network, "n" being the number of `confirmations` required. If `confirmations` was set to `3`, and the current block to be forged (or mined) on Ethereum is block 14, block 10 would be considered as trusted, but not block 11.

vega.OracleSpecToFutureBinding.description: OracleSpecToFutureBinding tells on which property oracle data should be used as settlement price and which to use the trading terminated trigger

settlement_price_property.description: settlement_price_property holds the name of the property in the oracle data that should be used as settlement price. If it is set to "prices.BTC.value", then the Future will use the value of this property as settlement price.

trading_termination_property.description: the name of the property in the oracle data that signals termination of trading

vega.Order.description: An order can be submitted, amended and cancelled on Vega in an attempt to make trades with other parties

batch_id.description: Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

created_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

expires_at.description: Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`, valid only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT`

id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus)

liquidity_provision_id.description: Is this order created as part of a liquidity provision, will be empty if not.

pegged_order.description: Pegged order details, used only if the order represents a pegged order.

reference.description: Which price point are we linked to

price.description: Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

reason.description: If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) reason will be specified - The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors

reference.description: Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus - Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

remaining.description: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED

side.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts

status.description: The current status for the order. See [`Order.Status`](#vega.Order.Status) - For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) value given in the `reason` field

time_in_force.description: Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires. - See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)

type.description: Type for the order - See [`Order.Type`](#vega.Order.Type)

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.description: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

batch_id.description: Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

created_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.description: the oracle spec describing the trading termination oracle filter

filters.description: filters describes which oracle data are considered of interest or not for the product (or the risk model).

items.description: Filter describes the conditions under which an oracle data is considered of interest or not.

conditions.description: conditions are the conditions that should be matched by the data to be considered of interest.

items.description: Condition describes the condition that must be validated by the

operator.description: comparator is the type of comparison to make on the value.

value.description: value is used by the comparator.

key.description: key is the oracle data property key targeted by the filter.

name.description: name is the name of the property.

type.description: type is the type of the property.

id.description: id is a hash generated from the OracleSpec data.

params.description: Risk model parameters for log normal
Risk model params for simple modelling

factor_long.description: Pre-defined risk factor value for long

factor_short.description: Pre-defined risk factor value for short

max_move_up.description: Pre-defined maximum price move up that the model considers as valid

min_move_down.description: Pre-defined minimum price move down that the model considers as valid

vega.Trade.description: A trade occurs when an aggressive order crosses one or more passive orders on the order book for a market on Vega

aggressor.description: Direction of the aggressive party e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

buy_order.description: Identifier of the order from the buy side

buyer.description: Unique party identifier for the buyer

buyer_auction_batch.description: Auction batch number that the buy side order was placed in

buyer_fee.description: Fee amount charged to the buyer party for the trade

infrastructure_fee.description: Fee amount paid for maintaining the Vega infrastructure

liquidity_fee.description: Fee amount paid to market makers

maker_fee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

id.description: Unique identifier for the trade (generated by Vega)

market_id.description: Market identifier (the market that the trade occurred on)

price.description: Price for the trade, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

sell_order.description: Identifier of the order from the sell side

seller.description: Unique party identifier for the seller

seller_auction_batch.description: Auction batch number that the sell side order was placed in

seller_fee.description: Fee amount charged to the seller party for the trade

infrastructure_fee.description: Fee amount paid for maintaining the Vega infrastructure

liquidity_fee.description: Fee amount paid to market makers

maker_fee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the trade occurred, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

type.description: Type for the trade - See [`Trade.Type`](#vega.Trade.Type)

trades.description: A set of one or more trades

vega.Transfer.description: Represents a financial transfer within Vega

amount.description: A financial amount (of an asset) to transfer
A signed integer amount of asset

owner.description: Party identifier for the owner of the transfer

type.description: The type of transfer, gives the reason for the transfer

vega.TransferBalance.description: Represents the balance for an account during a transfer

account.description: The account relating to the transfer

balance.description: Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places and importantly balances cannot be negative

id.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

market_id.description: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

owner.description: The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

type.description: The account type related to this account

balance.description: The balance relating to the transfer

vega.UpdateMarket.description: Update an existing market on Vega

key.description: The unique key

value.description: The value for the network parameter

vega.ValidatorEvent.description: An event related to validator management with foreign networks

id.description: The identifier of the validator
The identifier of the validator

source_id.description: The source identifier of the event

proposal_id.description: Identifier of the proposal being voted on

timestamp.description: Vote timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when vote was submitted to the network

total_governance_token_balance.description: Total number of governance token for the party that casted the vote

total_governance_token_weight.description: The weight of this vote based on the total of governance token

value.description: Actual vote

receiver_address.description: The address into which the bridge will release the funds

vega.Withdrawal.description: A withdrawal from the Vega network

asset.description: The asset we want to withdraw funds from

created_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the network started to process this withdrawal

expiry.description: The time until when the withdrawal is valid

receiver_address.description: The address into which the bridge will release the funds

id.description: Unique identifier for the withdrawal

party_id.description: Unique party identifier of the user initiating the withdrawal

ref.description: The reference which is used by the foreign chain to refer to this withdrawal

tx_hash.description: The hash of the foreign chain for this transaction

withdrawn_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the withdrawal was finalised by the network
